title: Slipknot to Reissue Debut Album for 25th Anniversary, Share “Prosthetics (Demo)”: Listen
description: The band’s self-titled debut will be reissued with alternate mixes, original demos, and more
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The band’s self-titled debut will be reissued with alternate mixes, original demos, and more
text: The band’s self-titled debut will be reissued with alternate mixes, original demos, and moreSlipknot are reissuing their 1999 self-titled debut album for its belated 25th anniversary. Out September 5 via Roadrunner, the new edition will be available in digital, 2xLP, and 2xCD formats, or as a deluxe 59-track, 6xLP box set. Listen to a previously unheard early demo of album cut “Prosthetics” below.The Slipknot (25th Anniversary Edition) box set includes the original album; rough mixes from Slipknot’s sessions at Indigo Ranch Studios with producer Ross Robinson; original demos; alternate mixes courtesy of Jay Baumgardner and Lars Ulrich; and live recordings from three shows during the band’s first world tour.Slipknot released their latest studio album, The End, So Far, in 2022. html:
The band’s self-titled debut will be reissued with alternate mixes, original demos, and more

Slipknot are reissuing their 1999 self-titled debut album for its belated 25th anniversary. Out September 5 via Roadrunner, the new edition will be available in digital, 2xLP, and 2xCD formats, or as a deluxe 59-track, 6xLP box set. Listen to a previously unheard early demo of album cut “Prosthetics” below.

The Slipknot (25th Anniversary Edition) box set includes the original album; rough mixes from Slipknot’s sessions at Indigo Ranch Studios with producer Ross Robinson; original demos; alternate mixes courtesy of Jay Baumgardner and Lars Ulrich; and live recordings from three shows during the band’s first world tour.

Slipknot released their latest studio album, The End, So Far, in 2022. They went an anniversary tour for their debut last year.

All products featured on Pitchfork are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Walden Green is a music writer and cultural critic who joined Pitchfork in 2024. A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, his work has appeared in Dirt, The Fader, and Philadelphia. He lives in New York. ... Read More
